topics.body:
If you need to use the toilet but you're wearing a space suit, what would happen?

If a T-Rex were to turn into a zombie, would it occasionally target people's heads to get their brains?

If an object moves at the speed of light might time travel, how come light itself never time travels?

If you were to fart near lava, would it explode?

If training animals is possible, can you train some to rob a bank?

If the Moon exploded, would its chunks fall onto the Earth and destroy life as we know it?

If I were to touch someone's brain, would they have occasional spasms and reflexes?

If I were to make to back tire smokes like those racing cars do before starting, would it dig a hole?
topics.author: 4fe1b9f47f123b13df002976

topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53913a1763687257e43e0100#post_53913a1763687257e43e0100

1. Depends. Am I in space or Earth?

2. Considering the size, that would be the first limb they would grab. Two birds with one stone.

3. Lightspeed is a constant. Matter that travels at the speed of light is the one that is subjected to change because of it's composition.

4. I think your ass would melt if you have to be that close

5. Watch the movie Doberman.

6. It could cause severe damage, but depending on how big they are they could cause major damage or burn on the atmosphere

7. Surprisingly, yes. There are studies about that stuff.

8. Only if on dirt terrain. On asphalt the tires would end up burning long before doing something

(All this are subjected to be wrong on scientific basis)
topics.author: 4fdfbf92945b7075d50036e4

topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53913a1763687257e43e0100#post_53913a1763687257e43e0100

1. space suits have a special thing for that kind of thing.

2. since zombies dont exist yet we dont know if they target brains or not.

3.you time travel if you move FASTER than light.

4. iunno, but it would do like a flametrower maybe.

5.yes, unless it requires complicated things like remembering numbers, maybe if you put a cam in it and a walkie talkie to give orders but it will still be imposible for it to go trough certain obstacles.

6. depends on how the chunks are, most asteroids burn out in the atmosphere and become little peebles.

7. no, nothing would happen if you touch it, not even pain, since brains dont ahve nerve endings.

8. depends on the terrain, on dirt? it would easily do it, on concrete? the tires would deflate first.
topics.author: 5154c5237f123bcd580002fc
